Reviews.Author: Daisy S "Daisy S"
Reviews.Content: For almost months now, I have owned this tablet and it has run wonderfully for  me.Because I used it so much, I have tested thoroughly  and found that it does have overall advantages. So as a techie, I tested this tablet out and below I will list what I have found to be the Pros and Cons of this tablet and have listed what I personally discovered. Then this will hopefully help you to decide if this is the right tablet for you or not...(By the way, to let you know,Something to consider: If you are looking for a COMPACT VERY PORTABLE and lightweight WiFi only tablet (and do not need the phone part), consider this tablet. (This is my favorite size because I can carry in my purse, tote, gym bag etc so easily! While it does not have every bell and whistle installed on it, it is a good choice for: Checking emails, Getting Online, Looking at Pictures, Watching Home Movies.Here are the Pros and the Cons below.PROS:1- WiFi connects easily and the signal is SUPERB in most places I tested. (Found the WiFi signal is VERY STRONG in my home and even in my backyard). This model has the strongest WiFi signal of any tablet or phone that I own! And it stays on the WiFi for long distances without dropping the signal EVER!2- The advantage of having a SD card slot that will hold up to 64GB.3- Small and lightweight. Comfortable to carry around and place in backpack or briefcase easily.4- Micro USB Port - This is common in most tablets these days, but the older Tab 2 line did not have micro port but the propriety wider port.5- Screen clarity - For me, I found this screen easy to read eBooks on and view internet pages.CONS:- 8GB internal storage - this it the advertized storage before Samsung added the OS, apps, Touch Wiz and because the OS takes up room, apps etc, take up room, the tablet just has about 4.7GB in the internal storage when you receive the tablet. No problem really I still have over 4 GB left on mine after all of my apps I added from Playstore.Bottom line and Summary:** Price and New to Tablet Person (or for a child/student) - For the low cost of about 160 (or less if used) dollars, this tablet will make a very nice FIRST TABLET or a TABLET FOR KIDS as it is a lower cost tablet that is easy to learn and has lots of features for the money. For just 160 dollars or so new, I find this a very good buy and this tablet may just be the one for you.** Experienced Tablet Person - If this is NOT your first tablet and you want a higher end tablet, and want to spend just a little bit more say about 90 more dollars, then you may want to consider the Tab 3 8.0 with 16GB of internal storage and larger screen etc. Also there are many very nice 7 inch tablets out there to choose from that have better specs and better screen resolution and better internal storage.If you are to have any questions about this tablet, you may ask me in the comment section and I will answer right away.
Reviews.Title: This compact tablet is easy to carry around, easy to learn with nice features! Detailed Review

Reviews.Author: rpv
Reviews.Content: There are too many tablets these days, right?! Samsung's third generation of Galaxy Tab series is highly anticipated and for this price point phenomenal. I have been using Galaxy Tab 2 and I will compare and contrast here. I played around with review units of all sizes and I have since returned them. My reviews are unbiased and neutral! First, if you have not had any tablets before, Get THIS! Yes, Get this 7". It is ideal for plane trips, long journeys. I had used a 7" Tablet on a long journey to listen to songs and read epub books (Aldiko) and it was a very pleasant experience. 7" form factor is lightweight, compact and great. If you are a bit experienced and can afford it, I highly recommend the 8". In my opinion 8" is the maximum value for the money and features and hence I gave 8" a 5 star. I gave 7" a 4 star (but no means undermining it). I gave the 10" also a 4 star because of some strange spec `limitations'.Samsung has introduced 7", 8" and 10.1" of the Tab 3 series. They are entering all form factors. As I know they have something in 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10" lines. Woo.. All of the 7, 8, 10" Galaxy Tabs come in white and golden brown color. My preference is white color. Looks pretty!Let's start off with salient points of all of the Galaxy Tab 3 series. I will later compare with the previous Tab 2 model.7-inch tablet: 1024 x 600, Marvell dual-core 1.2GHz processor, 1GB RAM, 8GB built-in storage (ROM), a microSD card slot (up to 64 GB), Camera: 3MP rear-facing, 1.3MP front-facing and weighs 10.58 oz. (300 grams). Android 4.1.28-inch model: 1280 x 800, Exynos 1.5GHz dual-core processor, 1.5GB ram, 16GB of built-in storage (ROM), a microSD slot (up to 64 GB), Camera: 5MP rear-facing, 1.3MP front-facing and weighs 10.9 oz. (309 grams) Android 4.210.1-inch model: 1280 x 800,  Intel Atom 1.6GHz Z2560 dual-core processor, 1GB RAM, a 16GB built-in storage (ROM), a microSD slot (up to 64 GB), Camera: 3.2MP rear-facing, 1.3MP front-facing and weighs 17.99 oz. (510 grams). Android 4.2I am not going into other details like accelerometer etc. as they are all standard these days, Audio support - AAC, AMR, MP3, OGG, WMA/ASF, 3GA/M4A, FLAC, WAV; MP3/MP4/Music Tones; Music Player; Ringtones, Polyphonic. Video support: AVI/DIVX, WMV/ASF, FLV, MKV, MP4/3GP, WEBM; Video Player; Video Streaming. Software is current of release date, and it is expected could be upgraded as next version Android 5 Key Lime Pie. (Currently targeted for Oct 2013). Key Lime Pie's one of the main touting points is compatibility to avoid fragmentation, so I can foresee, all of these models being able to upgrade if Google keeps their promise.The 7" has a physical home button so are others in the series.  Also has capacitive Back and Menu buttons. Camera is a 1.3-megapixel front-facing camera for skype, and a 3-megapixel rear-facing camera. It is also equipped with an IR blaster so it will work as a universal remote on both your TV and cable box. Camera is only so and so, and I will not rely on it to produce outstanding photos. Weighs only 300 gm. 64 GB SD card is awesome! With prices plummeting for 64 GB cards, it is a great boon. Put all your music, books, photos on the SD card and you have a powerful computer in hand always! I personally use the 64 GB microSD card on my mobile devices. Get this mobileUltra (SanDisk 64GB Mobile Ultra MicroSDXC Class 6 Memory Card with SD Adapter - Retail Packaging.Galaxy Tab 2 is 345 grams, so Tab 3 is lighter by 45 grams.  Processors are similar 1.2 GHz dual core in Tab 3 Vs 1 GHz dual core in Tab 2. Resolutions are same with Tab 2 1024 x 600 pixels (~170 ppi pixel density). Tab 3 supports up to 64 GB whereas Tab2 is 32 GB. Not a big deal unless you have tons of video/photo/ebooks/music you want to carry with you all the time. I use a mixture of on device storage + Google Music + box for my data needs.  Battery is also same between Tab 2 and Tab 3 7" versions - Non-removable Li-Ion 4000 mAh battery.Both have Bluetooth 3.0.  I cannot confirm still if Tab 3 7" supports OTG.  I know for sure Tab 3 8" supports as I tested it.  USB Host is one of the most undernoticed features of Androids and is in my opinion one of the best features compared to iPad lines. What this means you get a USB Host cable also otherwise called OTG (On the Go) cables and plug in your USB thumb drive or other USB devices and the device recognizes it. I have used it with Alfa AWUS036H for a wireless project with Android PCAP Capture from reputable Kismet wireless.  Another much ignored feature is the TV-out (via MHL A/V link). Unfortunately the 7" does not support it whereas 8in and 10.1 in supports it. You can connect Galaxy devices to a TV to make it truly a fantastic computer if the device supports MHL. Throw in a Bluetooth keyboard and it is awesome. Leo Laporte's TwIT TV which is Internet based show has one full episode in Know How on covering this topic. GPS was spot on and I tried multiple GPS apps. It was bright outdoors (had to crank the brightness all the way up). I personally use Navigon from Garmin and have downloaded several apps.Finally, believe me, don't get mired in the spec game. 7" is equally capable as a 8in for `most' day to day apps. If you are reading books, browsing, listening to music, looking at photos 7" is more than enough. Samsung is creating markets for all form factors and I would consider this as an exploratory stage. Just like Ford or Toyota has cars in different shapes, sizes and price range, so are the tablet vendors now. Remember the laptop wars, 10", 12" 13", 15, 17 and even some 19" if I remember right few years ago. We used to debate endlessly which laptop sizes are better, which has better speakers and so on. The time has come to fight it out for tablets!I tried following apps and they just worked awesome. A tablet is only as good as the apps you have and how productive it makes you. It's almost like the camera/lens analogy in the DSLR space. What good it is to have a great DSLR body if you have no good lens? Same with Tablet body and apps you have.WolframAlpha (I can go on for hours praising this. This is a truly genius app powered by hundreds of supercomputers in the background. Wolfram is a computational genius). Well worth the $3 price.Withings HealthMate. (another remarkable app great UI/UX). I am getting the Pulse device as soon as it hit stores. I have been using Fitbit and just itching to get the Pulse as I like the intergrated weight/track runs in one app)Aldiko Book Reader Premium (absolutely love it)Amazon MobileAndroid StatusAndroid Central app (great and must have for Android users)AndroidifyAngry Birds (Space/Seasons)Asphalt 7Amazon App StoreBattery Monitor Widget Pro (a great app)BeyondPod (excellent for podcasts, I haven't used Pocketcast, some friends say it is very good too)BoxCar Maintenance Reminder ProChromeCloudShark UploadCNET TVDespicable Me Game! And weather widget (cute for kids)Dictionary M-W PremiumDragonvaleNAVIGON (from Garmin - offline maps)Google Navigation/Earth/Maps using a portable MiFi boxGoogle Currents (nice way to read News)Google Keep/Keboard/Drive/Search/Books/Voice/HangoutsDraw SomethingEbayLinkedinGoogle Music (Awesome, I have now upto 10,000 songs halfway through Google's 20K Limit)Tapatalk HD (awesome forum browsing app)OverDrive Media Console: Library eBooks & AudiobooksMicrosoft One Note (legacy docs, skydrive of 25 GB is good)Subsonic Music StreamerTerminal Emulator (still need to use vi, yes this is it)TweetCaster Pro for AndroidASIN:B007R6PKBY Twit.TvSkypeSphero (Awesome bluetooth ball game)RealCalc Plus (Awesome calculator app)Tweetcaster Pro (again awesomeness)Plenty of WidgetsAsk questions, the reviews cannot do full justice. I will be glad to answer any questions and usually answer within 24 hours to any query.
Reviews.Title: Excellent form factor, and good improvement from previous model

Reviews.Author: Arnab
Reviews.Content: I have an ipad,which I use for everyday.Was looking for something portable and cheaper for travel. I bought this product after a thorough research on all the contemporary products at this range.Samsung has done great with the package and look. I got mine in white and it looks great,easy to carry especially if you read when you travel . Good thing they added the home button which makes the navigation much simpler and faster. Memory is expandable upto 64 gb. Comes with an unique feature tv remote,it's pretty cool to be able o control ur smart tv without any additional hardware. It has a sensor which communicates perfect with various brands of tv. The difference of this remote from the other ones,is this does not require the tv to be on network. Samsung watch on is a great feature, I think this wasn't there in the earlier versions. Jelly bean processor,1.2 ghz dual core processor makes the navigation much smoother than galaxy tab 2. The price is a big plus for this one. Now comes the cons. The voice assist feature is very very slow and robotic compared to Siri. The wifi connectivity needs improvement. It's not that fast compared to apple( but you get what you pay for). One more negative point is the resolution , kindle fire hd and nexus has hd resolution for the same price when this product comes with hundred times lesser resolution of 1024*800. Don't know why samsung dint add hd which is very very common in the recent devices. Other than all this ,if you are looking a easy to carry,light,smart and stylish device with a great storage and most Importantly cheaper tab, then this is the one for you
Reviews.Title: Excellent product and a great choice

Reviews.Author: Nick Adegite
Reviews.Content: Did some research as to high quality but low cost tablets and found three main competitors; Galaxy tab 3, Google nexus 7 and I-pad mini. Granted I-pad mini isn't that cheap but size wise in same bracket.I purchased the SG tab 3 because it was comparable price to nexus 7 but huge interest in expandable storage. Since I brought that up I'll address that now. Expandable storage was a great concept but wasted idea. In past android was able to move all apps to your SD card in order to improve your performance for your device.SD Card:Currently however, it appears everyone and there mother has moved away from that feature. Basically, songs and documents can be moved over to the SD card and the card itself is purely internal storage. Doesn’t sound like a bad deal, well here’s some insight. If you like apps like mostly everyone does, the more apps you have, the slower your tablet will operate. I found myself waiting more times than not for simple apps to load or simply swiping to the next screen. If you want a tablet for the sole purpose of looking at pictures and opening documents, you got a winner. If apps, gaming, and productivity are you’re strong point, this tablet is not for you.Features:The next point of information, the SG tab 3 is the lowest grade tablet for the SG market. It does have a beautiful display and when the planets align a generally good overall experience but this usually only happens when you first load the tablet, remove any background tasks and operate only one app, like a new reader. Instructions on features for the tablet are none existent and if advertised features on the internet sparked you interest for this tablet, it’s only for the SG tab3 8 inches. Not even the 10 inch has theses bells and whistles.The pull down menu is however amazing allowing you to control all features such as turning on and off options like Wi-Fi, airplane mode, battery saving without ever having to open the settings. Some features have like the auto dimmer for instance end up being more of a pain then a luxury constantly changing your screen brightness making it usually to dim.BatteryAs far as the battery life for the tablet….don‘t hold your breath. If max charge is achieved it is after several hours of charging. Once you’ve waited 2.5 to 3 hours to enjoy your tablet, the power quickly drains away never really reaching that advertised 8 hour lifetime.This next point I have separated because it is VERY IMPORTANT…UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU DEPLETE YOU’RE BATTERY TO 0%.  A common grip on the internet is that tablets of all brands and style are not turning back on. Either China is pissed or android has got a major problem on their hands. Once the battery dies from use, unless you immediately charge it after dying, you’re tablet will not turn back on. If you think I’m joking go to this link [...]I understand they are saying it happens to the SG tab 2, but Tab 3 owners of the 7.0 inch beware…it happens to you to. I received my tab on 9/6/2013 and it died 9/10/2013. RIP Tab 3, we never really got to know each other. That aside I have requested for another to replace my currently dead and defective SG tab 3 7 inch so we shall see how that pans out. If it doesn’t work out, there’s always I pad. I will admit, though my hate or apple is quite large, they know how to make a fully functional device.Overall:Screen has great display and movies look great as well as reading whether it be books or comic books. The Google Play store has a ton of apps making the tablet a good source of entertainment but don’t get too many apps of you’ll bog down your tablet. No matter how big your SD card is, it won’t make you tablet faster. Features are basic and are comparable to that of a generic low budget tablet. The SG tab 3 operates fairly slowly no matter how much ram you free up. Battery life is abysmal and if you ever let the battery reach zero, you’ll never turn it back on again unless you have your charger with you at all time. Hate to say it but if Android is lacking the tablet department and unless you want to spend high dollar for a tablet ($300+) you might be better off using your smart phone.Good luck and happy hunting,Android enthusiast.
Reviews.Title: Raging Disappoinment

Reviews.Author: Truthteller
Reviews.Content: The Samsung 3 7" should probably not be considered in the same grouping as the other Tab 3 products (the 8" and 10.1"), because it is so much less that either of those.  The problem isn't that it is poorly made, just that it is missing some very important features found on the other models, and it is way overpriced for what it does have in today's market.Before going further, and not to insult any other reviewers, but I have read a lot of reviews on this product on many websites now, and the conclusion I have come to is that the people who rave about this product very often are 1) speaking from a very short experience with it or 2) this tablet is their first one and they have neither good comparisons, nor have they researched the market well enough to know where this tablet fits in the current market in terms of features and pricing. It is a nice "looking" tablet.  Mine is white and its "handsome".  It's size is comfortable, although it is slightly heavy for its size".  It is thin and pretty sleek, but all of that is pretty superficial.  It is, however, at least "last year's" technology if not 18 month old, and so is the pricing.There are several reviews here which indicate people had the Tab 2 7" and were pleased with it, and then "upgraded" to the Tab 3 7" and were blindsided by the throwback in technology.  While I have not owned the Tab 2 7", I have looked it over, and compared it to my Tab 3 7" and I have to agree. The Tab 2 7" has the same resolution screen as the Tab 3 7" but the older one is brighter and has higher contrast, which can be important if you are in brighter lighting.  The Tab 2 7" uses a 30 pint connector, which some don't like, but one very important aspect to that connector was that you could buy numerous inexpensive cables and accessories (for under $5) that allowed you to plug a card reader, thumb drive, hard drive, keyboard, mouse or game controller into it.  The Tab 3 7" has a more standard micro USB port, but it is only useful for charging the tablet or to connect it to a USB cable to interface it with a computer.  It will not acknowledge any of the other devices mentioned, regardless of the cable you use because Samsung decided to remove the hosting ability of the USB port on this model.  The Tab 3 8" for about $100 more or the 10.1" both have hosting USB and work with a cheap OTG USB cable.  Not the Tab 3 7".What this means is that your only choice for storage of images, documents, music or videos is to transfer them onto a micro SD card and use the micro SD reader in the tablet.  If you have stuff already stored on a full size SD card from your camera, or a thumb drive, you have to use a computer in between, or WiFi or Bluetooth if your other devices have that ability.  Most Android devices since about version 3.1 (the Tab 3 7" uses 4.1.2) have a host USB port.  Google suggests they all SHOULD (their emphasis) have one.The screen itself is acceptable but not that sharp.  You can do much better with resolution, brightness and contrast in the same price range with other brands.  The colors are a bit muted on the Tab 3 7".The WiFi and GPS are both weak.  Mine unit drops the connections quite often.As others have mentioned, although the Tab 3 7" allows you to put up to a 64 GB micro SD card into the unit, it only can be used to store personal media (documents, music, movies, images, etc).  You can't access and run apps from it.  The 8 GB RAM within the unit is pretty limited, as the basic OS and out of package apps leave you with under 5 GB left to store apps.  Once again, currently the market in tablets supports units with 16 to 32 GB internal memory for about the same price as the Tab 3 7". The unit has a dual core 1.2 GHz processor, but its pretty slow for those specs and gets bogged down easily.  Once again, in the same price range one can find tablets running faster processors of dual to quad core and 1.5 to 2 GHz.The provided factory apps are enough to start with, but basic.  Unfortunately, Samsung, like everyone else, wants to get you to their own app store for content (ebooks, movies, and other media) and so they have apps for these gateways.  I don't see any advantage over Google Play and other options, and those extra apps just take up precious RAM space.Like several others have mentioned, my unit has been a bit flaky so far. The auto screen brightness gets stuck in dim mode and won't come out of it unless I reset the brightness manually.  The screen occasionally jitters for no apparent reason.  The screen text size will suddenly decide to shrink while I am scrolling with one finger.  For a while, when I asked the weather report, it gave me Cambridge Mass, even though I am on the west coast of Canada.However, by far, the worst aspect of this tablet (besides the inflated price for its features) is Samsung's customer service.  Their people are very pleasant, will promise you the world, and will deliver on nothing they promise.  They do not advance your case even when they say they will, they do not email you back even when they promise, you can call them, email them, it makes no difference.  They basically give lip service. Their "executive customer service" supposedly a second tier, is a joke.  Do not expect any assistance from these people, you are on your own, whether it is a technical question or a warranty issue.If you do not believe how bad their support is, Google Samsung Customer Service Reviews, their are literally thousands of complaints you can read.If this tablet cost about half of its list price, I would probably give it 2-3 stars, but these days ratings are not just about what you get, but what you get for the price you pay, and how that compares to other products on the market, and so with that in mind, the one start seems appropriate.  Lastly, for those of you who are wondering why I ended up with this device when I know what else is out there, it was unfortunately a gift.  I just want to warn those of you who can select a tablet yourself, that you can do much better for the same money with other brands (and maybe even customer support that cares about you).
Reviews.Title: Overpriced in todays market, Much better value out there

Reviews.Author: Denise M. DiFalco "The Greatest Revenge Is Yo...
Reviews.Content: Outstanding portable electronic device.  I'm writing a book and my husband & I travel alot.  Tired of carrying my laptop around and the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 seemed to be the perfect little investment.  Whenever  and wherever I get ideas I can pull my tablet out of my purse and write down things I need to remember.  Love the various applications that can be downloaded from the Google store for free or at a low cost.  I can watch movies, read my e-books, download favorite rock tunes, do my banking, shop at all my favorite stores and even read our Church's Bible lessons on my Samsung.  Convenient and worth the small cost.  I love that it synch's with my samsung phone and my desktop pc.  As a reviewer for a number of websites I can do my assignments while on vacation in my extra time rather than wait til I get home to complete with worry of not making deadlines.  Also love all the space for contact numbers and addresses.  I've bought three tablets in the past that I was not happy with, this one is staying with me.  Highly recommend~
Reviews.Title: My Constant Companion, Samsung Galaxy  Tab 3,~zero complaints...

Reviews.Author: Ordinary guy
Reviews.Content: First off I am not nor do I pretend to be an expert on tablet devices.  I own three: the original NookColor, which is highly outdated and is now used by my grandchildren. A 8.9" KindleFire wi-fi/4G which both my wife and I really like.  And this Galaxy Tab 3, 7".Making comparisons is very subjective since what I like maybe isn't what you're looking for.I definately like the Tab 3.  It has good screen resolution for a 7".  Decent sound from its tiny stereo speakers located on the bottom when its standing upright. It's easy to use and came with a lot of apps.  Any other apps are readily availabe.  I downloaded the Amazon app program and the Barnes and Noble book reader so I have access to everything I already paid for from those two sources.One thing I like about the Samsung that's not on the Kindle is I can view QuickTime videos taken with an I-phone.  The Samsung offers you the opportunity to convert Q-Time to a more usable non-Apple format.This is a very competetive market and tablets will undoubtedly offer more features for less money as time goes by. If you're looking for an affordable, easy to handle tablet with lots of features you can't go wrong with the 7" Galaxy Tab 3 by Samsung.  In it's latest edition Consumer Reports list it in the best product for its category. Nice!Brief update after exploring this tablet:The more I use this device, the more I like it.
Reviews.Title: Lotsa fun for 200 bucks

Reviews.Author: R Rated "Keeping it real"
Reviews.Content: I'm a long time user and owner of Samsung devices including the original Tab 1 and currently have the Note II smartphone.  I lead with that information in order to provide some context in describing the Tab 3 which is simply a wonderful device for the money and for the ease of operation in most anything you'd want a tablet for and to do.The display is far improved over the earlier tab.  It's like going for SD to HD in one fell swoop.  The setup and getting it synced with the home network wifi was far easier than I had thought it would be.  The same can be said for tying into the Google disciplines.  Once I set up my existing Google Gmail transfer, I was able to easily tap into my existing Amazon kindle account and start reading from my personal books library.  The Tab 3 is fast, looks great and is easy to operate.  Also, within the first 10 minutes of setup, I accessed my Netflix account and was viewing various movies which came in LOUD (good volume/speakers) and clear.Summing up, the Tab 3 is a significant upgrade over the first Samsung Tab and for the price of about $200, I don't see how you can beat the value with any other device out there.
Reviews.Title: Under-promises & OVER performs=Excellent

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I got this as my first tablet, and I must say I really like it a lot. The size is perfect to fit in one hand. The screen is nice, bright, and clear. It's perfect for what I wanted and needed it for. It took a while to figure out and get used to (and after having it about 3 weeks I'm still figuring out a few things).Youtube videos are good quality. The only issue with these is that sometimes your hand blocks the wifi signal so the video buffers until you move your hand, or in some cases I've had to hold the whole tablet away to get the signal back.Apps and games load quickly and are fast and clear.I use chrome as a browser and at times it is a bit slow loading pages, but usually closing active apps and clearing the ram helps the speed a bit. The ability to stretch the page to zoom in is useful for sites with very small fonts/images.It's very easy to customize your pages (once you figure out how) and personalize the tablet to your liking. I have played around with ipods and ipads and they have no customizing other than moving the app icons around, so using the android wins in this case. It's hard to find wallpapers that fit the screen properly, but since there are so many other ways to customize the tablet with widgets and such, it's not a big issue.The 8GB space (which is really only around 5GB when you get it) isn't very much but is fine for using a few apps and playing games. You have the option of adding an SD card, but since I don't plan on downloading movies or music I won't need it, since you can't put apps on the card anyway.The camera quality is pretty good, especially outdoors. Indoor photos aren't quite as good and are more grainy, but there are always apps that make photos more clear.If there was one thing I'd want to have on this tablet is better notifications. That's one of the only ways the ipod/ipad beats this with features. Often the tablet makes a sound when there is a notification but nothing comes up on the screen at the same time or even shows on the lock screen. If you want to see what the sound was for, you have to unlock the tablet, pull down the top bar and then see it. It's much more convenient to see a notification message pop up right on the screen.I've recommended this tablet to a few people already. Maybe in the future I'd even be willing to spend a bit more to get the 10-inch one (especially since I really want the split-screen feature). But for the price of $200, this is a high-quality tablet.
Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet

Reviews.Author: Twylajane
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this for my seventy year old mother and she loves it. It is simple to use and fits her needs to surf the web, read e-mail and play solitaire. She even figured out how to watch videos all on her own. So thumbs up on this little tablet
Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (7 inch)

Reviews.Author: Ravi Kumar Siluveru
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I am using tablet. My thought for buying 7 inch tablet is that I can hold it easily rather thatn 10 inch one. For that purpose it is good for me. Features wise also it is good. But coming to battery life it is really worst. I need to put charging entire night and I can use it hardly 2 hours. My kid plays games for 2 hours and battery is down, again I need to charge. I am afraid now, if I can take it out or not when I am going for a long drive.
Reviews.Title: Battery life is really pathetic

Reviews.Author: Mr. Ryan
Reviews.Content: I LOVEEE this tablet. I have been looking for a nice portable tablet for a long time now that was priced well, meaning I was not planning on it being an apple product. (Wayy too overpriced)  I love the small size, it isn't too small but it is convenient to see and work on, plus can fit in a pocketbook or large pocket.  The IR reader and TV app are a huge sell for me, the ability to see what is currently on without disrupting the current channel and then have the tablet control the tv is awesome and easy to set up.  My parents fell in love with it as well, So you know what they are getting for Christmas! :)  The front and rear camera are great, graphics are awesome.  I would not trade it for a $500 apple tablet.  I like the ability to add and remove the microSD card as well.  The battery life is great and charges really fast.  The promos you get with the tablet are pretty exceptional as well.
Reviews.Title: This is a must have, must give for Christmas, best bang for your buck!

Reviews.Author: D. Knoll "D knoll"
Reviews.Content: I had a very hard time getting this thing to print on the road. I bought the hp 100 office jet printer to print in my truck.  This does not work at all with an ipad. So I bought the galaxy tab 3 7" as it is android and bluetooth and has the ability to print. WHAT samsung does NOT SHARE is that the galaxy will only print to a samsung printer!  What kind of crap is that. There is plenty of software that hp has but it is no help.  Finally I find this app for $13 called printershare that will let the samsung communicate with the hp officejet 100.  This works but forget printing a document more than 3 to 4 pages long.  Somewhere the 3rd or 4 th page gets lost.Not a plug and play.
Reviews.Title: Printing instructions not there.

Reviews.Author: Dmitri
Reviews.Content: It stops working after 32 days...and does not charged anymore..Support could not help me..they said charge for 1 hour from PC, etc..but device completely dead!!Please stay away!! it looks like unit was not tested properly, not passed even simple QA and QC, don't waste your money!!Customer support could not help you in such case..
Reviews.Title: It stops working after 32 days...

Reviews.Author: Enrique Fernandez Roberts "Stray Dog and comm...
Reviews.Content: This tablet pc WILL NOT TRANSFER APPS TO THE SD CARD! Because of its anemic storage capacity (8gb, and half of it is used up by worthless shovelware which can't be uninstalled), users of this tablet will want to transfer apps to the sd card. Unfortunately, Samnsung's Galaxy Tab 3 will not support ANY App to SD applications.Say you download a movie from vudu. The Vudu app does not show up in "my files" and can't be moved, even with a "workaround nor with "rooting. "  So even if you have a 64 gb sd card, your storage capacity is extremely limited.  Since all downloads go straight to your internal memory (NO SUPPORT IS OFFERED FOR YOU TO DOWNLOAD STRAIGHT TO EXTERNAL SD), for downloads you must remove the the sd card, download the item to your sd via pc, and then put it back in.For those of us who download large files (like movies and pdf files), this is an unacceptable oversight.  I chose this tablet over the nexus 7 specifically because of the sd slot.  Now it is too late to return this garbage tablet.  So don't be a fool like I was. Buy a tablet that will suit your needs.  I can guarantee, beyond a shadow of a doubt, that it WON'T be this garbage tablet.Before any Android/Samsung fanboys get all defensive,  this is a well known manufacturer's  issue that vendors always fail to mention. Samsung has NOT offered any solutions to this serious problem. And trust me, with only 5 usable gbs of memory, it is a BIG problem.  Again, the usual workarounds do  NOT work with this tablet.Oh, and to those who say this is a Google issue, I disagree.  Many tablet manufacturers were aware of this and provide ROMS that allow App2SD to work.  Also, Android OS 4.2 will not have this problem.  I had read that the Tab 3 runs 4.2 but it does NOT, it runs 4.1.2.  According to Samsung, who I contacted directly, their 4.2 update will include App2SD support.  BUT, they have no idea when they plan to provide the update!Meanwhile, other tablets are already running 4.2 and allowing for App2SD to function properly.
Reviews.Title: It's hard to believe Samsung can sell this garbage legally

Reviews.Author: Signman Dave "Signman Dave"
Reviews.Content: As a contractor on the go the Tab 3 offers all the features I require to stay competitive. From contact management to local suppliers apps the 4G LTE affords our supervisors and project managers a compact easy to use tablet. When combined with the Otterbox case and the Galaxy S4 our communications have improved ten fold. From office apps, the opportunity to view PDF files and the estimating applications we have bought this is definitely the tablet for us. Durable and long battery life are a huge plus as well as the small size that allows the device to be carried in a jacket pocket while on the job site are a huge plus. Manage multiple email accounts and view both personal and business mail in the same front page widget. Estimating apps sync well with the office desktops or laptops allowing for fast data transfer and by using the HP eprint app this has been great for interoffice correspondence. A real workhorse for the construction trades.
Reviews.Title: Construction trades friendly

Reviews.Author: Patricia Tricorache
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for four months, and barely have the energy to try to use it. To wake it up, I have to press the button repeatedly, or even try the power button. Eventually it does turn on, and that's when the challenge begins.Most times I am trying to watch a video, the tablet freezes and makes a maddening noise. The only way I was able to stop it was by trying to turn it off repeatedly, since I couldn't figure out how to open it and remove the battery.Typing anything when browsing the internet is a challenge. I press a letter and it takes a few seconds for the letter to be entered. And it freezes or opens other pages when I simply get my finger too close too a link. If I try the back button, it usually doesn't work or simply kicks me out of the internet.I should clarify that I have not overloaded my tablet with apps. The internal memory has more than half left. Samsung support suggested I clear my internet apps completely, but this didn't work. I simply hate this product and will have to try to get it replaced or just throw it out the window.
Reviews.Title: Did I get a lemon?

Reviews.Author: Scott H.
Reviews.Content: You really can't complain about this little tablet for the price ($129.00) at the time of purchase.  My wife has had it for a couple of month now and it works perfectly.  Not had any problems with the tablet slowing down, hanging-up, etc..  If you need a simple day-to-day tablet you should give this a good look over.  It's not super high tech or bleeding edge technology, but it works very well for 95 percent of what you'd need a 7" tablet to do. Recommended.
Reviews.Title: White Samsung Galaxy Tab 3

Reviews.Author: Jean Bernard DuPoux
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed, purchased this product as a christmas gift and after 45 days it just died. no way to fix it, will cost more to fix then buy a new one. Read how many people are in the same position as me!
Reviews.Title: Product Died after 2 months!!!!  The warranty doesn't cover it !!! MANY PEOPLE  same issue. these are junk, AMAZON sells junk!

Reviews.Author: Yulia Danielyan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet for Christmas gift, today is December 28th and the tab , stoped working..... only 4 days of using it's too sad.
Reviews.Title: stoped working..... only 4 days of using

Reviews.Author: L.
Reviews.Content: What sold me on this is the other reviews I had read...and being I am an avid Samsung user for many years now..I didn't even need to take out the manual...set-up is a cinch...I am a first time tablet user so anything that doesn't require to much thought,works for me..the screen is absolutely crystal clear...nice weight and feels good holding it...and lets face it...THE PRICE IS RIGHT!!
Reviews.Title: an easy one to use...

Reviews.Author: Jeannie K
Reviews.Content: I am so loving this tablet. Very good size when traveling and everyday use.  Will recommend to others about this product
Reviews.Title: Love this product

Reviews.Author: Kenneth Takada
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet because I was in the market to upgrade from my iPad 1gen. I was curious about it and my friends that have the Galaxy phones always speak very highly of it, that and the attractive price all sounded pretty good.That said, it's got a wealth of features including the micro SD expansion slot (which is a huge plus). Having come from iOS, it was a little hard to get used to, especially with muscle memory being accustomed to the iPad layout.Started up just fine and the display was really nice. Took a minute to get m bearings straight and download apps. After that, it was pretty easy and quick.My issue was with the tablet freezing up when I browse. It happened pretty often in the 3 days I owned it... That and the screen was flickering a little.I bought a smaller tablet because I'm going on deployment in a week, having issues like that immediately after purchase was enough to make me take it back.I ended up going with what I know... An iPad mini.I reaaaally wanted to like this tablet...
Reviews.Title: I really wanted to like this.

Reviews.Author: lmc
Reviews.Content: Update: My wife got the order last night and before she wrapped them I tested them out! Great!Have to say what a great tablet this is! I have a Google Nexus 7 and I always find myself using my wife's Galaxy Tab. Samsung just has done such a great job with the interface and the hardware.Of course, our kids want to use both our tablets and so I am getting the three of them the kids edition of this Galaxy Tab. It is basically the same powerful hardware but has a child-friendly grip and easy-to-grip C Pen. It also features an interface for kids which the parents can control what apps the kids can play and a timer on how many hours they can spend each day on the device.Amazon has the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 Kids Edition here. Amazon always has the best prices. :-)[...]
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet - Version for Kids is Awesome!

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: So I just bought this as a Christmas present for my older girls .I tested last night and I really liked it was fun to use easy to use and I got a present black Friday price of 159.99 and had a 100 gift card. The camara was easy to use so where all the other features. I was going to get a couple cheap tablets but those say play store and you actually have to install it which I have no time or patience for I like the Samsung name and I thought it was a well crafted tablet.I like The remote feature and when I get a smart TV I'll try it out.
Reviews.Title: samsung galaxy tab 3 7.0

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Timblin
Reviews.Content: If the battery dies completely, the tablet must be disassembled with special tools, and then reset by disconnecting the battery, and then reconnecting it.  This has now happened twice, uuuuugh.Other than this major flaw, it is a below average laggy tablet, but you don't need to expect much from a $120 tablet.
Reviews.Title: Don't let the battery completely die unless you like disassembling the tablet with special tools!

Reviews.Author: Loren Hunt
Reviews.Content: I started with a pre owned Tab 3. It was about a 25% savings so I gave it a try. It looks like I bought someone else's problems. The battery life was less than 45 minutes of reading at low screen intensity and in airplane mode. It would also crash and reset the date to 2011. Amazon return policy is excellent. 2nd unit was brand new and is perfect in every way.
Reviews.Title: Good if you get a new one

Reviews.Author: Chris Boylan "MrBoylan"
Reviews.Content: First off, if you already own this tablet, and are having a problem getting your device to charge, turn on or power up, see below for a fix. For those considering buying one, here are my thoughts.Samsung makes great Android tablets (for the most part). I've owned a Galaxy Tab 2 and done some testing of other Samsung tablets as well.  They're responsive, offer a pretty straight-forward interface, full access to the Google Play Store (unlike Kindles), front and rear cameras, Bluetooth keyboard *and* Bluetooth mouse support and expandable storage via the microSD slot. This last bit is important if you want to keep local copies of music or movies (e.g., not rely on the Cloud) for mobile media entertainment.Also, the inclusion of an IR (InfraRed) port on the Galaxy Tab 3, and the remote app allows you to turn your tablet into a full-fledged touch screen home theater controller at no additional cost. For a gadget freak, this is pretty cool.  Overall, the fast processor, expandable storage, relatively low price, and wide selection of apps make the Tab 3 an excellent choice for a 7-inch tablet.But my experience with the Galaxy Tab 3 has been marred by a recurrent problem: sometimes the Tab 3 will become unresponsive: it won't charge, nothing lights up, and it won't turn on. This happened to the white Tab 3 I bought my daughter for Christmas after exactly one day of use. It happened again on the Tab 3 that Samsung sent as a replacement (the yellow kids' version) after about a week of use.  The first time, my daughter ran the tablet until the battery was exhausted and the unit shut itself down. After that, it never turned back on again despite multiple charging attempts from the factory charger plugged into the wall, or the factory USB/microUSB cable plugged into a computer.I looked online and found all kinds of suggested fixes: Hold the power button for 10 seconds, 30 seconds or 60 seconds (no joy).  Hold the power button and volume down button (again, nope). Hold the power button, home button and volume up button.  Still, NOPE! Try a trickle charge - plug the Tab 3 into a computer via the USB cable instead of the wall charger hoping that the lower amp charge from the computer would "trickle charge" the battery and fool it into charging. Again (at least for me) - FAIL!  But you are more than welcome to try these approaches as they are pretty simple and completely non-invasive.*HOW TO REALLY FIX THE POWER UP PROBLEM*What did work for me was to disconnect and reconnect the battery, then plug the unit back into its factory wall charger. After less than a minute, I saw the battery icon on the screen, and the unit began charging normally. Hooray! The only bad news about this is that it's not as simple as removing the back of a Galaxy phone. In fact, it's possible that attempting this will void your warranty, so proceed with caution!Getting the back off the Galaxy Tab 3 requires gently prying the edges away from the screen in the little crack between the screen and the case all around the perimeter of the screen. Doing this properly requires a thin plastic pry tool and some patience. I used a small jack knife, but would not recommend it due to the risk of scratches or even shorting out something inside the case. Once you've removed the back of the unit, gently lift the battery connector off its port by prying it toward you. Once it's disconnected, plug it back in by pushing it back down into place. Replace the cover by gently placing the tablet into its shell and pushing along the perimeter, snapping all the tabs back into place.There's an excellent video of this on YouTube by a user called, "JerryRigEverything" - search for "Galaxy Tab 3 Battery Replacement" and you should find it.  The only part you need to watch is the first one minute and 15 seconds to see how the cover comes off and how to separate the battery leads from the motherboard. You don't need to physically remove the battery or remove the screws that hold it in place to detach the battery leads from the motherboard. Once you've put it all back together, plug the tablet into the factory wall charger and USB cable. Within about a minute you should see the battery icon appear and normal charging should begin.Without this "little" issue, I'd rate the Galaxy Tab 3 as a 4-star or 5-star product. But with this major inconvenience, I have to downgrade it to 3 stars.  If it had only happened to one sample, I would have written it off, but seeing it happen to two different samples, and seeing how many other people are saying the exact same thing, I have to think it is endemic to all Tab 3s and it's only a matter of time before it happens to most owners. Let's hope Samsung figures out a software fix for this. Otherwise expect to see a bumper crop of factory-refurbished Tab 3s in the near future.If this helps you get your Tab 3 back up and running (or doesn't!), please let me know in the comments.By the way, in our case, the failures occurred when the app, "Dragon City" was running while the battery died. I know that can be a flaky app so am curious as to whether others who have this problem are also running that app.UPDATE: One more piece of flakiness on the Galaxy Tab 3. My daughter was unable to connect to the internet on her tablet the other day, even though it was successfully connected to WiFi and our router was fine. Upon investigation, we saw that the Tab 3 had reset its date to 1/1/2012. Once we went in and manually updated the date/time to the correct values, the tablet was able to connect to the internet again. No idea what caused this, but it's apparently another common problem with this tablet.
Reviews.Title: Nice tablet, plagued by a pesky power problem. Here's how to fix

Reviews.Author: polska blondynka
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet as a gift and I am currently writing this review from it! I originally wanted something smaller for college to replace my laptop. I know for a fact that this tablet will not fail me. Besides using it for school work, I do travel a couple times a year, and sometimes bringing a laptop seems like too much. I plan on using this tablet for entertainment on flights.I'm not super techy but I love electronics. I can tell you that this is a great choice for all you out there who prefer a 7inch over 10inch. It has lots of space but if you find you need more, an SD card is always compatible.I have a white Samsung Galaxy S3 and I love it. Samsung makes some awesome phones and tablets.Do I recommend? Absolutely.
Reviews.Title: Sleek, clean, perfect.

Reviews.Author: Myles Horvath
Reviews.Content: Great value on tablet.  Bought it for my son to watch movies and play games. This is a mid grade tablet. For better resolution and experience go for the 8 inch.  Has better features like mirror technology and better screen.  I own the 8 inch and works great. I'm also a technology buff.  The 7 inch is for my young son.  He won't notice the difference with resolution or speed. So saving the $100 was the best option. Still 7inch is great. Does what it needs to do and is way better then those off brand tablets for $100. Spend the money and get a samsung.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet for price

Reviews.Author: TIR "TIR"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet for my 11 year old niece and I must say that I am very pleased with the overall performance. I have been looking for a small tablet for her for about a year and while I have a mini & a new ipad; I did not want to spend that much on something for her. I looked at the Nexus 7 (specs included) but I could not make myself like it as much as the reviews I read. I also looked at the Kindle and while the screen was beautiful, I did did not like the fact that it was not as easy to download epub & pdfs as I would have liked.I have had an android phone for years and every time, I upgrade my niece gets the old phone. She loves android and she is extremely proficient with apple products. Well, I read the reviews for the Samsung tab 3 7 inch and I wasn't very impressed. I decided to give my niece my mini and while she was greatful, she wasn't that excited. My husband suggested we buy the Samusung anyway and from the moment she took it out the box, she was excited. This kid has thoroughly tested her tablet and I heard her say to her big sister (who has an ipad 3), I love this. She is a smart tech savvy kid and I told her to tell me if she had any problems with wifi, heat, etc. She is still going strong and is just as pleased as ever. I played with her tablet and so did my husband (who has the new ipad)  and he said if he needed a 7 inch that he would consider this one. The screen actually looks nice with pics and we zoomed in on pdf documents and words were surprisingly clear. She has been playing games and I asked if there is any lag and she said no. The internet works fine at my house and at my sisters.I bought a mini because I did not like any of the small android tablets available in late 2012; but if I were going to buy one for myself now, I would lean heavily toward this tablet. I was presently surprised. I typed this review on my Macbook. As you can see,  I have a lot of apple products; but I also have an android phone. Some people like spec sheets, which are important; but sometimes other factors can affect your final decision.
Reviews.Title: Very Nice

Reviews.Author: Hasi
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Costco and was disappointed with it's performance. It only has 1gb of memory and most of the apps got stuck. Returned it and got a nexus 7. My advice to all is go for a nexus 7 and you will be far more satisfied.
Reviews.Title: Poor performance. Do not buy.

Reviews.Author: S. Gayle Puckett
Reviews.Content: Love it. Met expectations.  Really use it a lot. Couldn't ask for any thing to be any better.  Thanks for sending
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: D. Best
Reviews.Content: This is my very first tablet and I love it.  I'm still learning all the things it can do.  Love the portability of it.
Reviews.Title: First Tablet I've Owned

Reviews.Author: William A. Roe
Reviews.Content: I received my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 and had no problems setting it up. Two days later when I went to use it the screen was frozen and would not allow to use the tablet.I made three calls to the Samsung Tech support people This did NO GOOD at all. I felt they were lacking in solving the problem. Their answer was " you need to send it in for service" I called Amazon and they provided me the option of a refund or a new device.In all fairness I elected to try the tablet. I can only say Amazon is the BEST. I will post  a updated review.
Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab3 7-inck, Gold Brown

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did what I thought was a good deal of research before buying this. Unfortunately, none of the review articles (and certainly not the Samsung site) will let you know that this device will not work with many of the accessories. Most important is the lack of an HDMI connection via MHL/micro-USB port (I also wasn't able to get any of the micro USB to USB connectors to work with this device and couldn't get the Peel remote to control the TV). I didn't find this out until I had already bought a MHL/micro-USB to HDMI connection and tried to get it to work. Don't bother, it wont. If you want to attempt to connect this device to a television, there is no good way that I can think of. Apparently the 8 and 10.1 models have this capability. Nothing on the Amazon or Samsung websites point out this discrepancy. Even the older (Tab 2 models) can be connected via a dock, not the Tab 3 7-inch though. Returning my 7 inch tablet as a result.
Reviews.Title: Less than stellar compared to 8 & 10.1

Reviews.Author: K. R. Marshall "ruess"
Reviews.Content: OK so I just returned my Galaxy Tab back to Costco and picked up the Nexus 7. Oh my goodness what a difference!Yes the Galaxy Tab is a lot more attractive design-wise in my opinion which is why I initially got it over the Nexus, but now that I've used both there's no comparison. For $30 more the nexus is nearly twice as fast, lighter and the interface is so much more intuitive and smart. The nexus comes with stock android which allows for for faster app switching and higher productivity in my opinion. What I didn't like about the galaxy is that they changed the interface but not in ways that made it better, rather ways that made it worse and more difficult to use.Finally the galaxy is slow, it's fine if you only want to read a book, but some high def videos were choppy, browsing was slow, and it bogged down when using multiple apps at once.Again, it's not a terrible device, and it's well made hardware wise, but if you have a choice, go with the Nexus as it will make you happier in the long run.
Reviews.Title: Get the Nexus 7

Reviews.Author: David Hardy
Reviews.Content: I have owned and used many Samsung products and have been happy with all of them in the past.  I wanted an affordable and reliable android tablet for around the house to replace an Original Kindle Fire,  so I purchased the Galaxy Tab 3.After I received the Galaxy Tab 3 and started using it,  I noticed how sluggish the interface was in comparison to other devices that I have used such as the Kindle Fire HD and the iPad Mini.  It also did not feel as "solid" as some other the other devices I was used to.  Under normal use such as web browsing or streaming movies, it got hot to the touch.  I also had to frequently reboot the unit to keep it responsive.Unfortunately, After about a month after purchase, the unit locked up and shut down to a black screen.  It would not come back on after that.  I have had to send it back for warranty repair and am anxiously awaiting the results of the repair.Other Samsung tablets may be better and may be worth the money.  However, I can not recommend this unit.
Reviews.Title: Not the quality I expected from Samsung

Reviews.Author: P. J. Campbell
Reviews.Content: When I first got 2 of these tablets for my 2 children just last Christmas, we were very happy. We the parents have iPads and very pleased with the performance of the galaxy tab for the kids....and they were pleased as well. The problem came when they let the battery die. The tablets refused to turn on even after being left to charge for days and trying all the 'resets' we found online. We have since returned tablet to Amazon who was very helpful and refunded the amount less a restocking fee. That restocking fee should be paid by Samsung as it is clearly a defect with their product ( just Google it and you will see how many persons have the same issue. ( the other tablet was purchased directly from Best Buy and also had the same issue and was also returned). A reasonable expectation would be for such a device to work for more than 3 months. Samsung needs to fix that problem!!We have decided to just stick to what we know and love.....Apple products cost more, but will work and in the unlikely event that there is a problem 3 months after from normal use, you take it back to the Apple Store and they'll replace it .
Reviews.Title: 3 month old tablet just will not turn on !!

Reviews.Author: sheryl johnson
Reviews.Content: I wanted this tablet cause I figured It would be like my phone and it is the problom is its almost exactly like the phone its to restricted from certain on the web I wanted a tablet that was more like a laptop like my last one. I like it but I dont love it it often freezes and the worst freeze and kicks me out of what im doing. It has a fairly slow response on almost everything but otherwise its ok. I think it has a pretty good battery life.  But if I could I'd probably get something else. Maybe my expectations were to high but thats the product I have so im slightly disappointed.
Reviews.Title: my galaxy tablet

Reviews.Author: ReaderinReno
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent tablet with a screen that is good for watching movies, and a size where typing is not inherently difficult. The Android operating system has some Samsung things I didn't like (particularly the keyboard with its miniscule keys), but it is easy enough to download SwiftKey or Google Keyboard and fix that.I have the Sprint version, which isn't for sale here. The 4G works well and is reasonably priced. I spent some time in the store looking at this tablet and others (Kindle Fire, IPad Mini, Nexus 7, Galaxy Tab 3 8.0, Nexus 10) in the store. I found this one to be the best size--anything bigger was too big to hold vertically, with the 8.0 inch tablets being particularly awkward. I find the typing input to be good vertically and OK horizontally on this tablet.Overall very happy with the tablet. It comes with Polaris Office software, which I find really useful.  I wish the camera was 5 megapixels instead of 3, but other than that have nothing to complain about.
Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet

Reviews.Author: Kevin Green
Reviews.Content: Invested alot this year for Christmas in this present.  Bought 4 of them.  One for Wife and one each for kids.  Loved it so much that I bought one for myself.  I really like the MicroSD option to add disk space has come in real handy.  We all use them daily with not one issue on any of them.  The highlight of our Christmas that made it a success.  Great product!
Reviews.Title: first tablet ever

Reviews.Author: Connie Kopacek
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my husband and he loves it, he looks up all kinds of trivia on the internet. He is not a computer/tablet person but this was so easy to use it didn't take him long to figure it out. Bought 2 more for the kids.
Reviews.Title: Great item

Reviews.Author: Prairie Wanderer
Reviews.Content: Loaded a great app for making free wifi phone calls and is paying for itself. Voice command works well. screen is very responsive. Pocketable version of the 8.0. Good mp3 player. Have yet to try the GPS.
Reviews.Title: Good tablet

Reviews.Author: Diane Burritt
Reviews.Content: Just love it. Perfect size, everything works, I can watch netflix. I use Skype and it works great. Nocomplaints here.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: mspops
Reviews.Content: There is not much to say other than this is a very nice, high quality tablet. It works with a decent dual core processor speed although a quad core processor would of been very nice like the Asus TF300 we have! Great graphics, easy to use interface, and nice sized on screen keyboard. The only annoying issue I had was that I had an issue with the set up of the Samsung account, but, I cannot say for sure if it was just a slow connection with my wi-fi gateway. Received it in a timely manner and boy oh boy, Amazon customer representatives REALLY know how to give you a fantastic deal, especially if you couldn't buy (out of stock) what you originally wanted to purchase! I always return to Amazon for the best deals, period. Thank you Amazon for such a great buy!
Reviews.Title: A beauty of a tablet

Reviews.Author: andrew
Reviews.Content: tablet is perfect for me. It has 2 different app stores you can search through. Apps are great! I haven't had this long, maybe a week, but so far it has been so helpful. I love to get on facebook, and it is super fast. It updates quickly. Finding and connecting with wifi is super fast, and it sensitive. It picked up wifi great in my office, and the router was in a completely different part of the building. I love it! I love the alarms in the morning that updates me on current weather conditions, and the top news headlines
Reviews.Title: samsung Galaxi tab 3

Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: I have bought this tablet for my brother, as a gift, he is using it a lot and until now, no complaints(only one week).He told me that he uses every single day and really likes the size and the light weight!! I bought it , because the price was amazing and also because I like the face of this tablet.
Reviews.Title: So far so good!!

Reviews.Author: fanesa williams
Reviews.Content: Very nice tablet. Lightweight, reasonably priced and easy to navigate. Nothing bad to say about this tablet. Would definitely recommend.
Reviews.Title: Nice tablet

Reviews.Author: lala83
Reviews.Content: working just great use it for travel and games. Size was important and does fit in my purse with no problems
Reviews.Title: good

Reviews.Author: mahmlh
Reviews.Content: Seen some bad reviews for this.  I have to say that I don't agree this tab is great.  If you are familiar with the Android system then the useage of this tab should be no problem at all.  If you have a gmail account it will sync with it and load all apps and info to it that you have on other Android devices.  It does have instructions but like all Samsung products you have to go online to get the manual as that's how they do it to save paper.
Reviews.Title: love it

Reviews.Author: Lauren Paul
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this tablet. She uses it all the time. Its all that I expected. The seller ran out of white so I got in a goldish/brown, but I actually like this color better. So I am a happy customer
Reviews.Title: Best tablet ever

Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what is wrong with other people's tablet mine is fine and runs good as any other tablet. This is also my first tablet I have had a an ipod touch but wanted something bigger.Pros:Beautiful screenGood battery lifeThe charger cord is decently long which is a plus in my bookLightLOUD SPEAKERS (I compared to my brother's ipad 4th gen and my speakers ARE much louder)Comes with free $10 google play creditCons:Some apps can take a while to load if you don't kill some processes that are running.In the end I love this thing and it is a great tablet for the money!
Reviews.Title: GREAT Tablet!!!

Reviews.Author: jrzcell
Reviews.Content: I have other Samsung devices to link up with this one.  I can use the tv remote on some of my entertainment equipment but not all.  Over all I love the tablet.
Reviews.Title: Awesome device

Reviews.Author: GASHIE "GASHIE"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT, I was a little scared of getting one because I never saw this one at a store or anything. The picture quality is great even though its not hd. I just got  it so I havent done that much yet so when I do I will get in more details.. if it lives up to all my expectations for sure. Whould be cool if it had the note feature though...
Reviews.Title: AWESOME

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: It is a great tablet. I would recommend the galaxy line of products over apple any day. I have a galaxy media player 5.0, the galaxy s4 phone and and the galaxy tab 3 7" and all are excellent devices.
Reviews.Title: Samsung quality

Reviews.Author: Joi Hagens

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this thinking I was upgrading from my tired (yet still fully functional) Tab 2 7.  My intention was to give the old Tab 2 to my sons and I'd have a brand new, snappier device - wrong!  This thing was very sluggish since day one.  I decided to make a few tweaks to it (launcher, turning off some settings) but it never improved.  It was very sluggish, there was a delay to any action performed, and it would freeze just using Chrome  (pre-installed) until it would just restart on its own.  It also had random restarts even though I wasn't doing anything with it.  I'd want to think that I received a defective unit but found a lot of people having similar results with theirs.  I'm fed up with it, can't do basic things (I don't play video games on it - just read articles and watch YouTube videos).  So, it's going back.Edit 4/29/2014:  Forgot to add that the power button will get stuck so that will also cause it to turn off/reset.  Also, some apps like Google Play store would stop working and I finally noticed that the time would reset - different year, different day/month, different time and time zone.  Couldn't figure out why.

Reviews.Author: chadwick
Reviews.Content: This Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 is an all-around great tablet for the price. It runs Android 4.1.2 Jelly Bean, has a 1.2 GHz dual-core processor, with 8 GB of storage. This tablet is not the top of the line, fastest and best tablet on the market- it was designed to be a basic tablet and be affordable. For the price, you can't beat this tablet.The OS on this tablet is Android 4.1.2 Jelly Bean. The OS runs well on the system, and is able to handle multiple applications at the same time. The OS also includes the ability to force close apps and clear RAM.The Tab 3 is also well designed. It is encased in white plastic, with a metal strip around the outside. The power and volume buttons are on the sides, with touch sensitive "Back" and "Menu" buttons, and one physical "Home" button on the face of the tablet. The charger port and speakers are on the bottom of the tablet, and the headphone jack is on the top. There is also a compartment for a MicroSD card on the side of the tablet.The Tab 3 also includes a cool feature for controlling other devices- there is an IR port built in to the side. Software comes loaded on the tablet to set up with your TV, Blu Ray, cable box, etc. Plus if you subscribe to major cable companies, you can load their channel lineups and guides right on screen.There is one last feature worth noting about this tablet. Since it is a Samsung product, it comes enabled with Samsung All Share Play. This is a great feature that allows you to share Photos, Videos and Music between Samsung devices. It's easy to set up within the device's Settings, there is an option to "search" for other devices. In my case, I have mine paired with my Samsung UN46EH5300 TV (review for that coming soon!). So if I want to watch a video on my tablet right on my TV (currently stored on a 64 GB MicroSD card), I just have to turn my tablet on and it appears in my TV's input selection list! When the video starts playing the tablet becomes the remote, giving you options to play, pause, rewind, etc. This All Share Play also integrates with apps like YouTube. For example, if I am watching a YouTube video, I have the ability to "send" the video feed to the TV (as long as it is turned on).Overall- I would recommend this to anyone looking for a tablet for everyday use. If you have any questions, feel free to ask!!

Got it back, turned it on and it worked, but only for a few hours when it started doing the same thing as before. Called Samsung again and told them I wanted it replaced. The nice gal I spoke to said it is Samsung's policy to attempt to fix items two times before replacement. So, I sent it back a second time and waited another week and-a-half. Just got it back yesterday and loaded all my apps, etc. and it worked again, until today when it reverted back again to a different date and time... So frustrating!!!! Now, I've been on hold 37 minutes and still have not gotten anywhere. Hopefully when someone answers they will take care of me. I like Samsung products, but I won't buy another Tab 3, maybe they will let me upgrade to a Tab 4.

Reviews.Author: Dane R. Jones Jr. "G. W. Danar"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is good. Almost perfect size. Good size screen but still can fit in some large pockets. The stock memory of 8gb can be filled quick because some games can be 1gb in size. But the memory can be expanded easily and not for too much. Performance is good. I am still surprised by the graphics of some games. I just wish I could get or find a gimp or photoshop like app to do graphic designs on the go without having to root or basically hack the tablet. The wifi range is good if you are within your home or the same building as the router but it can get weak when  you are outside. I am looking for a way to boost its signal by maybe using an usb wifi adapter for rasberrry pi like boards and use a usb to micro usb adapter to connect it to the tablet. Should work since rasberry pi uses android and linux like this can but this tablet has to be hacked to root it so you can install linux while it comes with android out of box. I would recommend and buy this tablet again. Battery is about 12 hours with wifi off but with wifi on it can be drained in about 6 hours if you surf the net alot and can be drained even quicker if playing a game with 3d graphics while wifi is on. But with all the usb power adapters on the market I doubt that will be much of a problem for most people. I have two wall power adapters and one car adapter while only spending about 40 us dollars so i can not complain too much about having enough power for my needs.

Reviews.Content: I have the Gal 3 8 inch tablet. So when my son dropped & shattered his we decided to get him this tablet. We figured we'd get a refurb to save some money. It arrived sooner than expected. But there were issue with it as well. We contacted the seller & it was promptly addressed & we opted for replacement and figured we would give it another shot. Reviews.Title: This is good

Reviews.Author: Xavier
Reviews.Content: I ordered 3 of these tablets for my family and so far they've been great.Games, social apps, streaming services all perform above average. I almost went for an off brand tablet but then I realized that this was not that much more expensive for what I needed them for. My kids love them and stay glued to them for hours(after homework of course).I know they come out with a new model every year or so but in the mean time this will do then I'll probably upgrade to the new models when the time comes. Samsung and Android have made wonderful technology and I can't wait to see what's next.
Reviews.Title: Very satisfied

Reviews.Author: ben ross
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet from my sprint store as an anniversary gift for me and my girlfriend and I have been pleased with it ever since then( which was roughly 3 to 6 months ago ). I would definitely recommend somebody buy this tablet.Featuresone of the features I enjoy the most about this tablet is the amount of apps that you can use on the device, Skype, Pandora, Netflix , all run smoothly on it. you can also change out memory cards on this device to get up to 64 GB of storage. there is also an average battery life not exactly awesome but had to say itcomfortthis tablet is a decent size. it fits in your hand fairly comfortably even with prolonged use ( watching Netflix for about 4 hours ).  its also a somewhat light weight tablet its around one pound so not to great but not terrible.priceI paid fifty dollars for my tablet but that was only because of the deal sprint had going on., it was a very decent price. i admit if it costed any  more I would not have bought it though( only because i would not of had the money ).screen sizei like the 7 inch version over the 10 inch version because of the ability to change out the memory cards also the 7 inch is great for watching Netflix .accessory'sI admit I haven't explored much in the way of extras but I admit I bought the case that sprint had which was the standard case it was good. also my stylus pen works with my tablet so using my drawing apps is fun and easy.conclusionI would highly recommend this tablet for anyone who like to change out music or pictures via the memory cards , or the people who just like to have a tablet to do anything like playing games. I would also recommend getting a case for the tablet because I have dropped mine a couple of times and wouldn't want it to get damaged. ending note I would just like to say that this tablet is awesome !!

Reviews.Author: italo bolanos
Reviews.Content: This tablet, I have used and tested thoroughly and found that it does have overall advantages. So as a techie, I tested this tablet out and below I will list what I have found to be the Pros and Cons of this tablet. *Also, I own the Tab 3 7.0 3G (T211)UNLOCKED PHONE/TABLET COMBO (in white and I purchased it recently on Amazon and it is just 96 dollars more than this WiFi only one). The 3G model is a real phone and has a Micro Sim card slot in it. For just about 90 dollars more, I got the phone part and the 3g data abilities in the Tab 3 with 3g (which is very much worth the added cost). The P211 I also purchased on Amazon and now I carry it everyday as a phone and mini tablet combo. So if you need a phone and tablet in one unit consider the Tab 3 7.0 3g as it is just one unit to carry for phone and tablet! Both my Tab 3 versions are peppy and run great!

Reviews.Author: E. Sine "Javaman"
Reviews.Content: When it worked,  it was good - it was very very goodBut when it was bad, it was horrid.We purchased this as a student kit (included keyboard) and rarely used the keyboard.We ended up using this mainly for our daughter's videos on car trips (the expandable memory was nice).Then the apocalypse came.  During our last update (4.3.1 or some such) the file ended up being corrupted, and we were unable to recover from it.  Samsung was absolutely no help,  since we were out of warranty, they said "so sorry, can't help you, why not you buy a new one?"Tried everything under the sun,  system resart, cold booting,  system restore,  and each time it would show the little android guy falling over and saying corrupt files/data.Needless to say we became an expensive paper weight.That's too bad because we cannot recommend any samsung tablets anymore.  We have Asus now and they are running great for the same price and better processors.
Reviews.Title: worked great for a year then Bricked when update failed

Reviews.Title: Excellent all the way around!

Reviews.Author: M. Prieto
Reviews.Content: First the good, people put down the screen resolution being low, but samsung screens are one of the best , there 1024 by 600 resoution is so much better than other screen with same resolution . Side by side with my kindle fire hd i can barely notice much difference. The tab is not extreme fast but it is not slow either, if you install  a task killer or ram manger , you can keep the ram clear and it will improve your browsing experience. People say it take 3 secs more to open apps, really 3 secs if you cant wait an extra 3 secs, its time to slow down your life.  I test the wifi and it works great the bars are not correct , when iam outside i get one bar but the tab work perfectly still loading pages and loading u-tube, test it yourself u will find even with 1 bar showing the connection is great.This is a perfect tab for movies and emails, the size is quite small and light fits almost perfectly in my pants pocket.  Since the price drop you can find these as low as 149.00 , which is a great price for the tab. The tv remote is great for using the tab to control tv.  Most people make fun or hate samsung touch wiz, but i love it , it has lots of useful features and mekes it easy to use the tablet, i have own the nexus 7 2013 and yes it is faster and smoother, but i like the samsung so much better, with the nexus you have to be very gental as it is very thin I was always afraid the screen would crack.  Like i said if you install a ram manager or task killer and keep the memory clear , you will find the tab work fine, as long as your not expecting it to be blazing fast....  Really the only real bad is the 8 gigs of strorage which is about 4.5 gigs useable .....

Reviews.Author: Kase
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my son's birthday and he is in love with it. One of the features that he liked the most is the ability to video chat with me whenever he has WIFI access. 'Google Hang out', allows him to talk to anyone who has the 'Google hang out' app on their smart phone. All that is required is a Gmail account. It also had a neat app called Watch-On, this app acts as a remote control and can change channels, change the volume, power the TV and set top box on/off. Very cool app, very cool tablet, would purchase another one.
