Reviews.Title: crashes all the time

Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: First of all, I want to say I got this at a special in Best Buy for $139 dollars, so if a seller is charging more than that, he is ripping you off and you need to contact amazon. Its a great tablet for the money you pay(Unless you pay more than the amount cleared). Anyway, the tablet is great for music, pictures and quality for the price. You get a 50gb upgrade for dropbox and you can upgrade your memory to 64gb with a micro sd card. There is a little wifi problem, but, what tablet is perfect? Me, I'm a huge music fan and have a big collection, so with the micro sd card it fitted perfectly. Hardware wise, the specs are last years, but if you're on a budget, you can never go wrong with this one. The battery life lasts me more than enough, I'm a collage guy so i'm mostly listening to music and facebooking any chance I get. I recomend getting yourself a screen protector and cover, since the screen will get dirty with your fingers quickly. Great tablet overall.
Reviews.Title: Greatest budget tablet

Reviews.Author: Destiny N. Savage
Reviews.Content: should have spent the extra money for the galaxy 8"  2 weeks after getting this for Christmas its worked great, battery drained overnight and now it wont take a charge with any of the methods available from Samsung or online.  It is not the fastest tablet so after using my kids ipads it seems even slower now.Update  Spoke to Jon at Amazon and he quickly understood the issue and exchanged the broken one for a new one. Even paid the shipping both ways. Extremely helpful even with my having thrown away the packaging. Still not the best tablet but customer service was outstanding

I love it and the kids love it too. May order them one to play with during spring break. I think the price was an absolute steal. I amm very satisfied. Reviews.Content: I bought it mainly as a gaming device for my kids. I like the design; it is sleek, easy to hold and lightweight. I will buy an external Micro SD to see if it improves the response time.

Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I missed the low price sale and paid $159. It is fun to have in my house. It makes noises when I get mail or some other notification. It is there on standby to wakeup and do some quick web surfing. Battery life in standby is excellent. I have played some videos and the native player is limited on the CODEX it runs. I tried some free video APPS that kind of ran one CODEX better than another. I did not find a player yet that is as robust as some PC software (MPC, VLC). might help. I tried it in the car as GPS with some freeware, works OK. You can transfer GPX files (multi point GPS tracks). I might try some commercial GPS software.  GREAT screen daylight. I don't know if iPad is better, but for 1/4th the price it is great for me. My phone is an HTC EVO 4G and so the learning curve was low.... since the galaxy Tab 3 is an Android device as well.

They use their tablets each day playing games, skyping with relatives and friends, email, etc.  And what I love most is that they enjoy it.  It was hard to justify buying an ipad for them when the Samsung offers everything for them that an ipad would.  And our experience with all Samsung products has been a good one.

The price was $159 when I purchased it. I have the 10.1 inch Galaxy Tab 2, which I love, but I considered purchasing one of these for myself as well because of the handy size. I also have an S4 phone so I'm a fan of Samsung. I wished I had purchased one for my mother-in-law instead of the Kindle, which has no camera, no memory card slot and very limited apps.I'm very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Author: Seeo
Reviews.Content: Outstanding portable electronic device. I'm writing a book and my husband & I travel alot. Tired of carrying my laptop around and the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 seemed to be the perfect little investment. Whenever and wherever I get ideas I can pull my tablet out of my purse and write down things I need to remember. Love the various applications that can be downloaded from the Google store for free or at a low cost. I can watch movies, read my e-books, download favorite rock tunes, do my banking, shop at all my favorite stores and even read our Church's Bible lessons on my Samsung. Convenient and worth the small cost. I love that it synch's with my samsung phone and my desktop pc. As a reviewer for a number of websites I can do my assignments while on vacation in my extra time rather than wait til I get home to complete with worry of not making deadlines. Also love all the space for contact numbers and addresses. I've bought three tablets in the past that I was not happy with, this one is staying with me. Highly recommend~

Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: I definitely enjoy this tablet and the practical apps I use on it. However when it comes to video quality and fun apps that require video its very laggy and produces poor, low quality video and its also hard to get good lighting with the video camera. Also browsing the internet on this(Chrome, Google search bar) is very laggy and at times unresponsive. If you are using this tablet simply for practical apps that you would use daily such as banking, weather, stocks, Instagram, Facebook, pinterest etc. it performs fine in that department. When it comes to apps that would require using the video camera or camera for much detail (keep in mind the camera on this tablet does allow you to focus on one object) I would definitely go with a different tablet. But since I am not too invested in a camera on my tablet, I'm not too upset about it. overall, I am satisfied with my purchase but just had a few complaints.
Reviews.Title: Good for the price but you get what you pay for.

I bought my kid a Dell and it came with one already on it, perfectlyperhaps tablet makers can either follow suit or make it an option. An option that they could charge an additional, nominal fee, of courseaside from that I'm very well pleased with this tablet. It does all I need and more. Always been a Samsung fan.

Reviews.Author: B. Ginkel "bilobaman"
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a decent tab.  I like it for what I use it for.  Value wise, it is a 'great success.'  I use it as my car navigation/radio device.  First thing I did was root it (XDA developers is AWESOME).  I left the stock rom on there, but needed root access for the Tasker app to be able to do all the things I wanted it to do.  I use an Akron dash holder to keep it mounted in my car.  When I power on the car, it boots Pandora, Waze, and other apps I want open while driving.  This thing spends 98% of it's time on my dash.  It does all these tasks admirably.  I have no idea how well it will do in the Utah summer heat though.  This is the WiFi model, I use WiFi hotspot from my phone for data while driving.Pros:- Bright screen with decent resolution- Battery life is quite long (even though it is always plugged in while driving)- It's Android rooted, so you can do whatever you want if you know what you are doing- Audio is sufficiently loud (I normally have the headphones plugged in to my aux while driving but sound is good)Cons:- Doesn't do great in the cold, even though I can't expect that; if it's cold, prepare for cold warnings and no charging, sluggish LCD refresh.- Menu/Back buttons don't light up on this 7" model, sucks when night driving while trying to use it- Camera might as well not even be there, it has terrible resolution and horrible color.  Don't plan on using it for any reason.Overall, for a dash rider, it rocks.  Using Waze, Torque app for car data, Pandora or whatever music app you like, and Tasker seals the whole deal.  This app has a medium learning curve, but once you master it, you can make you phone do just about whatever you can imagine automatically.  8/10 would buy again.  Good for kids too at home with the WiFi.  If it breaks, oh well.  Not $500 bucks down the drain like an Ipad if it gets broken.  This thing has 200% more VALUE dollar for dollar over the Ipad.

Reviews.Author: M. Perry "M Perry"
Reviews.Content: I received this tablet as a gift, and as a proud owner of a galaxy phone, I like how both devices operate similarly. I know the phone is a higher end device in regards to resolution and raw power, but this tablet does everything I need it to, and much more. I like the build of galaxy devices, and this tablet is no exception. The screen is sharp and colors accurate. I noticed that the resolution is not on par with a lot of the new tablets, but the screen is still very clear and easy on the eyes. For the price, you really cant complain. Everything looks great on this tablet, and all the negative reviews you read are from really critical people. There is always something better out there in terms of specs, and you can drive yourself crazy comparing devices. Ibreally haveca hard time putting this tablet down, and I enjoy its performance. I use it primarily to web surf, shop onlinr, control my home theater, and basic tasks and it does them admirably,  with little lag. This is a great little tab, and am grateful to own it. Also, if you have a samsung smart tv...it integrates well with it. I consider myself a slight techie and this is a more than capable tablet except for maybe the most demanding games. If you use it for the basics and light gaming. Pick one up!!

If u don't have the right date stuff will go slow and your internet will work but it will ask u to check the certificate every time. Also the YouTube app and amazon app won't work. Reviews.Content: I got this tablet for my boyfriend for Christmas...He absolutely loves it..Colors are beautiful when streaming an event or watching a movie.
Reviews.Title: A satisfied customer

Reviews.Author: Rachel Brink
Reviews.Content: I have owned several different brands of tablets- the 1st gen 10" iPad, the original 7" Google Nexus (ASUS), and now the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3, 7". I must say that this Samsung tablet is by far the slowest and has the worst battery life of the three. I actually bought this tablet while it was on a ridiculous sale of $129.99, which is a very reasonable price, but I did expect it to either match or exceed the performance of the 1st-gen Nexus. It does not.I owned a Nexus 7 for EXACTLY one year (to the day!) when it fell off the dresser and cracked the digitizer, rendering the touch capabilities useless. Being a computer repair technician for a living, I attempted to replace the digitizer/LCD assembly- which is ridiculously difficult- and ended up frying the motherboard in the process. Because it was so user-unfriendly when it came to service, I didn't want to buy another Nexus, but now I wish I had..... This Note 3 is SOOOOO slow.
Reviews.Title: Very reasonable price if you don't mind the lag....

Reviews.Content: i recently bought this device and quickly noticed a few things.first, it has great graphics and sound quality.second, it is equipped with the Google play store.third, its wi-fi connectivity is very shoddy. if you are someone with a need for speed, don't get this device. simple acts such as changing the volume slow it down. it is very laggy. however if you enjoy sitting around for 5 minutes to open or even simply play on your games, this is the device for you.

Reviews.Content: I am a Mac user and have a Mac Air. Bought this instead of the Mac Mini because of its small size that is easily pocketable. Had the Mac Mini but not that pocketable with its larger screen. That said the Samsung is usable but very slow. Often have to wait several seconds for response to load a page or close an App. Also some of the Apps aren't as polished as those on the Mac. My Fitbit works fine on the Mac but not on many Android devices including this one. I paid $135. At that price it's okay but wouldn't pay more.

My friend purchased a Nexus 7  it was nice just not the bells and whistles I wanted.Long story short went to a local retailer for a hands on comparison...felt the Samsung was for me.  Sorry for those experiencing issues but the Tab 3 is awesome.. was very easy to setup found my home wifi immediately, the speed is all I need  had 3 email accounts set up in 15 min or less.  the screen display is bright and  vivid, the apps are plenty! I reccommend this to anyone who wants a easy enjoyable 7" tablet experience!

If I had known this before purchase, I would buy a 8" instead of 7".Mine won't charge after 6 months. Contact the Samsung CS, had it repaired with no charge. Through the quality is not great, but their CS works.
Reviews.Title: No MHL function, won't charge after 6 month

Reviews.Content: The Samsung is an improvement from my older model as far as the WIFI . The complaint I have with the unit is it lack the auto flash  for the camera.my older model had it. Samsung should have add flash and improve the camera. my complaint is with Samsung not the seller. The seller was great, just as promised in the ad. I love it I replaced the case and remove the plastic from the screen.All the functions work as promised.

The second one works, but download is far slower than my Kindle.  Wifi connections seem to be a challenge for the device.  Otherwise, it works great.
Reviews.Title: Good tablet - first was bad

Reviews.Author: Ryan Case
Reviews.Content: Bought this tablet for my son for Christmas. I have a GS4, rooted with a ton of customization and tasker automation. I wanted to start really making the move to the Android infrastructure away from the IOS infrastructure, and love my GS4, so I went with this tablet.This tablet looks good, feels good in your hand, has a great screen, I love the removable microSD card, but it is just under-powered and lags. I don't think that my 10 year old knows the difference, but if I had bought it for myself I would have returned it for the slow performance. Really too bad.
Reviews.Title: Good Form, Nice Screen, Underpowered.

Reviews.Content: Is a great item and convenient. I will recomended to any one. I want to order another one. The side is perfect.
Reviews.Title: I love it

Reviews.Author: Hedda Abbott "LV Mom"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this tablet for a number of months.  When on the internet, it will throw me off.  When playing games it will take me back to the desktop.  Sometimes difficult to hit a letter on the keyboard and othertimes you barely have to touch the keyboard for a letter to type.  When on the internet, especially Facebook, the screen will automatically enlarge and when trying to minimize the screen it will go back to the blank page and your have to ask for the site again.  I have tried calling Samsung but have not had any luck,  I will try again this week and hope they can fix the problems with this tablet.
Reviews.Title: Not all it's cracked up to be

Reviews.Author: R. Perry
Reviews.Content: It's a great machine when it's working fine, just like my Galaxy 3 phone but has a tendency to freeze often when playing games and has to be restarted.  It was given to my wife as a gift and she started to complain about the freezing.  When playing Angry Birds it acts kinda whacky.  I know that doesnt say much except that Angry Birds becomes un-playable.  The screen flashes, the birds do not react to the correct finger movements and go off in the opposite direction.  When play slots it will just freeze.  I hoping that Samsung will address this issue and put out a software patch to fix this soon.

Reviews.Author: cespy
Reviews.Content: The size and screen are great however those pluses are offset by the fact that it does not have enough RAM memory 1 gb).  You cannot uninstall the pre-installed programs which tie up much of the RAM memory. These preinstalled programs don't  leave enough memory to run the programs you really want to.  This leaves it very clunky and slow to move between apps etc.  Also while expandable memory with a micro SD card is a great idea, they do not allow you to install apps to the micro SD card making it much less advantageous. I would not purchase again nor what I recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Author: kittylover "MCB"

Love it and wanted something a few inches larger screenwise to watch movies on. Also as I am older I wanted something with larger print. I considered the 10 inch but glad now I got the 7 inch as I can still hold it with one hand. I can't tell you how much I love my new toy. It takes wonderful vidio and photos,no matter what others have said. I am not a professional photo shooter but love a decent picture and this tablet gives you one. It connects easy to Wi Fi on my pc. I love reading as well and it  is great for that. It has alot of other functions which i haven't explored  as of yet. I like the fact that since my phone,mp3 player are samsung as well that I can sync alot of apps with it. Good product for the price.

Reviews.Title: first time droid

Reviews.Author: L. Cupit
Reviews.Content: I know that my experience with the Samsung Galaxy will not deter most people from buying one.... As for myself I read plenty negatives reviews on the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 totally ignoring common issues other users had with the product only to purchase it and then discover I would have the same issues that others have expressed.My experience with the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 did not fair well for many reasons. I decided to purchase the Galaxy Tab 3 after hearing good reviews from friends & family bout the Samsung S4 Smartphone.  First issue that I had with the Galaxy Tab 3 out the box is that it will only pick an extra strong WIFI singnal in the same room as my WIFI router. I just purchased the router in recent months and never had issue with WiFi signals with any of our other WiFi enabled products....Smartphones, Laptop computers, etc. Potential buyers can & should confirm this WiFi signal issue with the Galaxy Tab 3 through a Google search on the topic. The Galaxy Tab 3; as with most computers; does auto-updates on the pre-installed applications and also any apps that I install through the Samsung/Google "Play Store". My Galaxy Tab 3 was giving me constant error messages when it would attempt auto updates on the applications. Last count I had 26 error messages....when I would clear them out the errors would cycle again. I tried to do the research online though Samsung and Android help forums on this one issue to no avail though it seems to be a persistant problem for many users with application update error -110.  A big negative for the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 is no ADOBE FLASH. This is a bad if like my family you have Amazon Prime as you cannot play movies from the website and there is no app for Amazon Prime movies. This is just a personal issue for me, but I had to create a username and password to use most of the applications pre-installed on the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3. This got extremely frustrating for me as I decided to forgo use of some apps because of this.  Also, when I was able to do a search through Yahoo search engine it was common to get a message alert message saying - "Too many redirects from search engine".  Needless to say, I will be returning my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3. Obviously others experience with the Galaxy Tab 3 has been good, but satisfaction would depend on what you plan on using it for.

Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that this was a gift so I did not order personally.  I received this gift in April of 2013 and it no longer works at first they said that the plug or the charger had a short when I called Samsung directly.  I took it into Best Buy and went to the geek squad to find out that it was neither it is the actually tablet itself.  When I received the gift I immediately ordered a leather case for it and a screen protector.  Then they asked me at Samsung if I dropped it.  because they don't understand why the USB port would be damaged so in order to send it to them there is a $34.99 charge and if the USB port has to be replaced which I already told them it did there are additional charges not to mention I have to pay to ship it and for them to return it which will be billed on my credit card.  The warrantee literally expired 16 days after I reported that it would not turn on and to no avail would they honor taking a look at it.  Just like my handbags if you don’t stand behind your product I won’t purchase it I am 40 years old and take very good care of my things however technology is fickle and even though the warrantee expired two weeks before it broke this product should’ve lasted much longer.  I am not a child throwing it around or dropping it.  I don’t even use it at the gym while working out I have a MP3 player that I have had for 3 years and still going strong by Sony.  Needless to say I am replacing this because I do like the tablets and will go with Google Nexus going forward.  Very disappointed yet again with Mr. Samsung.  Hope this review helps the next person purchasing it for themselves or a gift to someone else.
Reviews.Title: not a fan of samsung from way back and still standing

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "reverendlinux"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for two reasons. First as a replacement for my aging Kindle. I loved it, but it was on it's last leg. I wanted something I could easily tote around but could also do more than just read books on. Second, and more importantly, I'm in the IT field and wanted to get some experience with the Android platform. After 60 days of use, here's what I've come to learn about these devices.PROS:- Decent weight. The tablet plus the simple Belkin cover are about the same as a Kindle Fire; easy to hold and use as an e-reader.- Excellent design. The tablet overall has a good layout with buttons in the right place (versus in the way). It looks good and the components used seem to be of excellent quality. Although the casing is plastic, it's thick and doesn't flex.- Clear screen. Some reviews I saw marked this tablet down for having a screen resolution that was lower than competitors and not as sharp. Really, in comparison to other Android tablets I can't see a difference. Streaming movies look to be DVD quality with only slight blurring during action scenes. Colors are sharp. Print is easily legible.- Good performance. On occasion I get lags starting up an application or during use. But overall performance is responsive. I've only experienced a couple of application crashes.- Battery life.  Without the wifi on, the battery goes about a week.  With the wifi on, about two days.  Not stellar, but easy to live with.CONS:- NO ANDROID UPDATES. This is my number one gripe. The thing came with Android 4.1.2 while 4.4.2 was released nearly 5 months ago. I would expect slow or no updates from the bottom feeder tablets like Polaroids. But when you shell out $179 for a product from a company that's going toe-to-toe with king of the hill Apple, you expect a bit more in the way of updates.- Shiny screen. The screen is slick and super shiny. It shows finger prints really easy and is hard to clean. Glare can be an issue sometimes.- Screen responsiveness. The touch screen takes more pressure than it should requiring more of a stab than a tap.- Weak WiFi. The tablet can usually manage only about 3/4 signal strength unless I'm within 15 feet of my wifi router. Although I haven't found any dead spots in my 2-story house, the signal gets weak really fast as you move away from the router.- Camera. Although the rear camera is a decent 3MP, the front camera is pretty weak at 1.3MP.  Additionally, the cameras have no flash.- Crapware.  There's a ton of Samsung apps that I'll never use and no way to delete them (short of rooting it which most folks probably aren't going to do).In summary, this is a good tablet for everyday use and at a reasonable price.  It's met my original two goals of being a Kindle replacement and getting to learn Android. However, in comparison to my daughter's iPad Mini...well, there really isn't any comparison. The Apple (among other things) is more responsive, made of better materials, is regularly updated and has a better wifi range.  In the end, if you're on a budget, go with the Samsung.  If you're not, go with the Apple.

Reviews.Author: Cen
Reviews.Content: Having owned each generation of galaxy, this iteration is not up to par.  Don't let the trusted name of Samsung or Galaxy fool you into thinking that this is a similar product.Samsung has made it next to impossible to actually use an external memory card.  Google "move apps to sd card tab 3" and you will discover what many people have discovered. Functionally you have about 4gigs to work with for apps after the system usage.  With very restricted ability to moving apps to a card, that 4 gigs goes fast.The main camera is garbage.  No flash either.  They should have just skipped it and made the front facing camera better.The system is clunky and slow for today's apps.Samsung's separate account is annoying and useless.  It barges in to update or relog.  Nobody uses it, nobody cares about it, it's intrusive bloat.  Users are at the saturation point of user accounts across the tech world.We have one for a child and one for an adult.  With the amount of faults we found on each, we would have been better off getting non/Samsung tabs.  There are cheaper, faster, bigger it there.  The Samsung brand should not influence you on this one, since it is a misfit gutted option.

Reviews.Title: Pharmacy student/future resident needs help: Kindle Fire HD or Smasung Galaxy Tab 3

Reviews.Author: Josh Hudson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on Black Friday for $149.99 and will be returning it soon. This is a horrible tablet. I tried to play a game on it and it was moving in slow motion, the touch screen is not responsive, and the screen is mediocre. Luckily i was able to pick up the last 8gb Nook HD for $79.99 at B&N.; I ran the same apps on the Nook and it was SO much faster and ran sooo smooth. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: VERY POOR THAN EXPECTED

Reviews.Author: Marilyn A. Chorman
Reviews.Content: It's not Amazon's fault, but I never received my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3. The vendor Data Vision is conducting an investigation with Federal Express to find out what happened. FedEx said it was delivered to me but I never got it.  Therefore, I cannot provide Amazon with a review.  I really hope we get a replacement and that we can provide you with a great review.  Until then, we wait...
Reviews.Title: NEVER RECEIVED MY SAMSUNG GALAXY TAB3

Reviews.Author: D. M. Adam
Reviews.Content: I'm a Mac person. iPhone, iPad, iMac, Macbook.  I'm taking a class in cloud computing and we are working on Google drive.  I thought I'd buy an android device.  I thought android would be more compatible with all the google apps.This Tab3 is really clunky.  I found it s-l-o-w.  While supposedly running a 1.2gb processor and 8gb flash memory and 1gb memory.  It became really annoying while trying to open an app, then it would automatically close.I tried to load some music on it.  I found on Youtube, a suggestion to connect it as an external drive than upload.  I unloaded one album, but could never find the music.  Another suggestion was to download an app called 'Kies' -  Kies asks if I wanted ALL my music, and i checked 'NO' I then downloaded one album, when I opened my Galaxy Tab3, I couldn't find the music, but i did find my entire iPhoto library.Trying to delete my photos was impossible, unless I deleted them one at a time.  I had over 4,000 photos uploaded.Finally getting so frustrated, I wiped it, reset to original condition, repacked it and sent it back to Amazon.
Reviews.Title: I tried, Lord knows I tried.

Reviews.Author: Kyle Ryan
Reviews.Content: DON'T BUY UNLESS YOU ALSO INTEND TO BUY ALL PRINTERS ETC... FROM SAMSUNG (Forever).  Samsung, decided to prevent you from printing from Samsung Devices to anything but a Samsung printer.  I assumed this was a software glitch but Samsung verified that they made the phones that way.  Of course I may want to buy that HP PRinter that can print from everything (including all android devices) except Samsung.  This is simply Samsung deciding to inconvenience their customers (in my case former customer) in the hopes that they will buy their other more expensive printers (let alone they aren't even available near me).  Besides, why do I want to be forced to use Samsung products for everything in the future regardless of the value that they provide, the wireless printer Samsung won't print to is an HP and it prints from my HP computer, my microsoft computer and my Apple IPAD.
Reviews.Title: Used to be an Samsung Fan - No More
